Summary: After more than 20 years as a creative thinker, director and strategist, I believe the conventional agency model no longer has currency in today's rapidly changing, post-digital world.  Traditional agencies that operate in silos, deliver commoditised products and transactional services have reached a ceiling they can not break through. Equally, traditional consultancies who walk away once their recommendations and reports are submitted because they are unable to effectively apply, oversee and realise their strategies in the real-world are in question. Individually, their influence is limited. Their remit is narrow. And, their time is up.  Challenging boundaries, breaking convention and solving problems in exciting new ways have become second nature to me. Now, as MD of Wyatt International ‚Äì a group of bilateral B2B experts that collaborate and combine to occupy a unique space as both consultancy and agency ‚Äì I use this pioneering outlook to shape how my team and I accelerate digitalisation, transform performance, drive growth and create value for business brands operating in industrial, construction, materials, technology, healthcare, financial and energy sectors all over the world.   A first-class BA (Hons) creative comms graduate and an alumni of Cambridge Judge Business School (Exec Education), I began my career as creative - designer then art director - working in London for B2B technology brands such as Logica, Unisys and Apple and B2C clients like Cadburys, EA Sports and Lucas Arts. Switching to employer branding and digital marketing in late 2000, I rose from Creative Director to Executive Creative Director for TMP Worldwide developing integrated, brand-led and award-winning strategies for leading organisations such as E.ON, LTSB, JLR, The Ford Motor Company, Bombardier, Miele, Yell.com, GCHQ, Vision Express and the NHS.  Joining Wyatt in 2010, my role initially focused on developing our digital offer, improving strategic thinking and increasing the quality of creativity across the business but this quickly evolved to include a wider remit: namely, to dissolve boundaries between our services and create a seamlessly integrated offer for our expanding global client-base.  Since then, I have repositioned our brand, re-engineered our structure and refocused our strategy so that we can continue to adapt, evolve and deliver high-value business brand consultancy services seamlessly alongside world-class, audience-first digital activation. During my career, I have realised over 60 industry awards and 7 UK marketing firsts.

Education is, in my mind, a key driver of human evolution: we become more suited to our environment the better educated we are. Education increases our chances of survival as a species. Then in January 2010 a position opened up for Branch Manager of Now Career's Education division. I was offered the position and with no previous experience in sales or recruitment, I jumped at the opportunity and grabbed it with both hands. Why? Because a) a change of career would help develop me as a person and b) this particular career would mean I get the chance to help schools do what has always been a difficult task: find and retain good teaching and support staff.  In 2012, Now Education became a separate LTD company and after growing and running a desk for 6 years as well as growing and running a thriving business, I moved away from a billing/manager role and into full-time leadership of Now Education. Summary: I am a Tax Director with extensive experience of helping businesses achieve their commercial objectives tax efficiently.  Most of this experience was gained working for KPMG, the Big Four accounting firm, but I also worked for smaller firms before establishing Claritas in 2012. My Passion My passion in business is talking to clients to understand their business, its opportunities and threats and then working with them to develop a plan to achieve their commercial objectives.  These objectives are very rarely tax driven but sound tax advice plays a critical part in achieving them.  For example, there is little point in making an investment in a new project or in a new country if the post tax returns are insufficient to justify the risk taken. My Specialisms I advise on all areas of business taxation, including Corporate Tax, International Tax, M&A Tax/ Transaction Tax, R&D Tax Relief and use of the Patent Box, Management Equity and Share Options, Fiscal Valuations, Restructuring and Property issues.   Tax Compliance- Not a Commodity I also do tax compliance, with the focus on assuring you that your tax affairs are in order and that the tax effects of transactions that you have undertaken are accurately disclosed.  Too often, tax compliance is seen as a commodity product to be carried out as cheaply as possible with as much of the work and the risk as possible passed to the client.  I simply do not believe that that should be the case and I would far rather spend time talking through your compliance and the associated risks and opportunities with you than sending you a long letter full of caveats. The Businesses I Work With The clients I work with range from ambitious start ups to well established businesses with turnovers of up to ¬£200 million.  The common thread running through all of them is a desire to grow their business and achieve their objectives.

Summary: I am a Software Engineer and ISO Consultant, with 15 years' experience delivering mission-critical software solutions to businesses in Construction, Energy, Oil and Gas, Security, Defence and Technology. I am currently working on the implementation of new standards in the UK Retrofit sector - PAS 2035:2019 and PAS 2030:2019, as well as MCS. I firmly believe that a configurable software-based approach to standardisation has many benefits over traditional paper-based manuals. I am particularly interested in the application of modern programming techniques to automate the reduction of non-conformities. In 2014 I launched a cloud-based Quality Management System called Trade Engine, which includes Customer Relationship Management and Project Management features too. Trade Engine is configurable 'on-the-fly' by the organisations that use it, meaning that when business activities change, or processes and procedures are modified, the organisation's software can quickly be re-configured to implement these by the end-user. Specialties: Quality management, risk management, management system design and implementation, standards conformance, compliance management, cloud computing, SaaS, education and training.

Summary: Following a career leading large and complex financial services businesses in Australia, Asia, the UK and US, now I mainly  point people in the right direction and give support along the way.   I work with startups and established businesses on their sales strategy and implementation, to help them expand their businesses, locally and across borders, and to push forward in terms of expansion of products, territories, or innovations. I do this as an advisor and mentor, or non-executive director. For example, I am on the advisory board of the Fine Art Bourse.  I advise on technical and financial business decisions and processes and I also make relevant and useful introductions and build connections across global jurisdictions on behalf of my clients. One of the things I have noticed with entrepreneurs is that it‚Äôs really lonely, especially at the startup phase (but not exclusively!). Entrepreneurs must be very versatile and agile ‚Äì with a great idea, a healthy amount of optimism, a belief in their product, an open mind, and a willingness to grow. They want more than advice. They want to have a conversation or ‚Äúpick a brain‚Äù with someone who won‚Äôt judge, who has experience and where there are no risks or hidden agendas. I am constantly surprised which parts people find valuable out of each conversation. Over the past few years I have performed a number of interim independent, non-executive roles at operational and board levels. Summary: Too many B2B professional services firms are reliant upon repeat business and referrals as their only sources of new business. This is stifling their growth potential.  Typically, they don't want to market. Thy just want clients to come and buy! When they do realise they need to market, they soon find out that they don‚Äôt have the expertise in-house or the time to build it. Most often they find this out the hard way by trying to do it themselves! Or, they‚Äôve already tried to market their business but been let down by the marketing people and companies that they turned to for help. I see this A LOT! The problem is a lot of people think marketing is about them!  Their services. Their people. Their business history.  But you know what? No-one cares! If that stuff is relevant at all, it‚Äôs in the sales process, not marketing. Good marketing starts with focusing on the problems and opportunities that your ideal clients face.  Good marketing is about getting known, building trust, and generating leads.  Good marketing is about taking your prospects on a journey from being oblivious, to understanding that they‚Äôre afflicted, to being informed such that they know you can help.  And to do that effectively you need omni-channel marketing. You need traditional marketing and digital marketing. Heck, there's no such thing as 'digital marketing' anymore because everything is digital! At The B2B Marketer this is what we do for you. We help you to get known, build trust, and generate leads. And we do that by starting with Marketing Strategy, then we look at what the right tactics will be.  You can learn about our approach to marketing - which we call The Pyramid of Trust - here: https://theb2bmarketer.com/how-to-create-your-marketing-strategy/ Or you can cut to the chase and click on the phone box picture below to schedule a call with one of the team. Summary: I was really lucky that my parents were able to empower me to become a fully integrated, independent adult even though I have a serious disability. It all began before I was two when they built me a new kind of powerchair to give me the same level of mobility as other children at that stage: to free me first to be a toddler, so that each developmental step was right there ahead to seize throughout my childhood. They succeeded. I was 'The Wheelchair Toddler'. I am now passionate about making sure that that is still available to every disabled child born now. No patronising compromise. I meet parents who, like my own parents way back when, are not ready to give up their dreams and ambitions for their child just yet. Dragonmobility's vision is to see every disabled person fully integrated in the mainstream world in a practical way.  I don't think there's any experience I've had in my education and career that I don't call upon in my current work. I use my law degree and my corporate finance experience as much as I use my child development GCSE! Running an engineering workshop is much like my theatre production days - it's about bringing everything together behind the scenes to create exquisite moments of joy. We are a not-for-profit which competes with large international corporations; we know every child by name and build them a machine that fits with their (often quite tricky) body, and we provide the expertise of over 30 years to their parents to make that work and keep it working as they grow. We are looking to the child's future: not a medicalised future, but a life and a career and a family and all the things those parents always dreamed of. We need the support of the people who also believe in children's futures. You can help by supporting us at www.patreon.com/dragonmobility

However, you should consider another option: contracting an outsourced sales company just for these products. You have no costs involved as you pay only after the sale has been done. Our vendors highly appreciate our services and leave us handling the hassle of sales while they focus on their core business. We became part of their team and they consult us on strategic decisions.
